conclusion: Analyze the image to understand the setup of the tank and its walls.

The image shows a tank with an exterior and an interior. The tank has a wall of thickness \( t \) and a refractive index \( \sqrt{3} \). The exterior angle \( \angle DBC \) is \( 120^\circ \), and the interior angle \( \angle ABC \) is \( 60^\circ \).
The problem involves a tank with a wall of thickness \( t \) and a refractive index \( \sqrt{3} \).
The critical angle \( \angle CDB \) is given by \( \sin \angle CDB = \frac{1}{\sqrt{3}} \), which results in \( \angle CDB = 30^\circ \).
The angle \( \angle ABC \) is \( 60^\circ \), and the angle \( \angle ABD \) is \( 30^\circ \).
The angle \( \angle ADB \) is calculated as \( \angle ADB = \angle ABC - \angle ABD = 60^\circ - 30^\circ = 30^\circ \).
The critical angle \( \angle CDB \) is equal to \( \angle ADB \), which implies that \( \angle CDB = \angle ADB = 30^\circ \).
The distance between points A and B is calculated as \( AB = \frac{18}{\sin 30^\circ} = \frac{18}{0.5} = 36 \).
